intro: Wylia hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish wylia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellowish-green, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Wylia hispanica is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
